page.title: 01General Survey of Malmesbury
page.content: {Malmesbury}is a small town in the North West corner of Wiltshire, situated on a hill with the River Avon flowing around it on its way to the Bristol Channel. It is the oldest Borough in England, King Alfred having granted it a charter in 880 AD. The town is most famous for its Abbey. Only a small part of the once magnificent Abbey Church now remains. {King Athelstan}is said to have been buried there in 939 AD. The town has a thriving shopping centre and a number of new, small industries have moved there in recent years. The present population is{2500, but is growing steadily. It is unusual that for such a small town it has its own{hospital and part time fire {service.}We think it is a pleasant, friendly place in which to live.
